ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] EQ then and now
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Things are getting to be more Thing wise.  But I play doing the weekday mornings and really don t see that much.  Well beside folks camping the Orc s in EC
ygData.messageBody:
> Does anyone else feel this? Is it just the people I've been hanging out
> with lately being more "thing" than "people" oriented and I should go
> find some new friends? Or is it that not being the target market of the
> game I just don't get it and getting the coolest things is really what
> the game is about?
>

Things are getting to be more Thing wise. But I play doing the weekday
mornings and really don't see that much. Well beside folks camping the
Orc's in EC for the belts. Not just the levels they where made for but
higher levels wanting to twink here low level char.

But when the find out that someone who the orcs where made for they have
helped me to get a few belts and watch out over me.

> At any rate, my disatisfaction toward EQ of late has been profound.
> Profound enough that I can't bring myself to log back in. And I really
> think it is that they tweaked the game for the worse, starting with the
> addition of class specific armor and weaponry. Suddenly it's all about
> "stuff". Or was it always and I just missed the point?
>

Well Crushbone is like that, everyone wants that shiny shield or the
screaming mace. And I guess Highpass is like that too, for that shield
the gnoll drops.

> More importantly, if there were an RP style game tweaked more toward
> people than things, would you play it?

Sure would.

>If the game gave points for storyline and sometimes favored the underdog (letting the least equipped defeat the most equipped like a David and Goliath kind of story) and promoted group dynamics with more "realistic" story effects - would that be of any interest?
>

I would have to see what the plot was about, but sure if it caught my
eye I would give it a try.

Ranalla, The Lost Druid
